intro: Lecostomon terniflorum, commonly known as the three-flowered lecostomon, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has trifoliate leaves, with each leaflet being ovate and slightly hairy. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Lecostomon terniflorum is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, making it a characteristic species of coastal and mountainous areas.
